author: conclavia
body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

`Get-Help` does not find any help files after running Update-Help on a clean install of PowerShell 7.2.4 on Ubuntu 22.04.

- For a cmdlet only auto-generated help is displayed
- For an about topic no help is found

1. Install latest powershell package on Ubuntu 22.04
2. Update help files by running `Update-Help -Scope AllUsers -Force` as root
3. Use `Get-Help` to display help for a cmdlet or about topic

I have also tried running `Update-Help` with no parameters as both root and normal user.

### Expected behavior

```console
Get-Help Get-Command
=> Should display descriptive help for the Get-Command cmdlet

Get-Help about_Profiles
=> Should display descriptive help for the about_Profiles topic
```


### Actual behavior

```console
PS /home/user> whoami
root

PS /home/user> Update-Help -Scope AllUsers -Force -Verbose
VERBOSE: Resolving URI: "https://aka.ms/powershell71-help"
```

_No response_

`Update-Help -Scope CurrentUser` works fine.
```powershell

Platform                       Unix

PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

 > gc /etc/os-release
NAME=ArcoLinux
ID=arcolinux
ID_LIKE=arch
BUILD_ID=rolling
ANSI_COLOR="0;36"
HOME_URL="https://arcolinux.info/"
SUPPORT_URL="https://arcolinuxforum.com/"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://github.com/arcolinux"
LOGO=arcolinux-hello

```

comments.author: conclavia
comments.body: Tried `Update-Help -Scope CurrentUser` as both `root` and normal user on Ubuntu, but no luck - still only getting partial / auto-generated help files.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @sdwheeler Can you please take a look?

comments.author: sdwheeler
comments.body: Non-Windows platforms do not have a reliable way for PowerShell to determine the language setting of the OS. For Ubuntu, you must run `Update-Help` with the `-UICulture en-us` parameter. The need to do this varies by Linux version and distribution. For example, specifying the culture is not needed on my Debian 11 test machine.

comments.author: sdwheeler
comments.body:
Apparently, `Update-Help` is looking at the `$env:LANG` environment variable. On my Ubuntu 20.04 machine it is set as shown:

```powershell
PS /> dir Env:/LANG

Name                           Value
----                           -----
LANG                           C.UTF-8

PS /> Get-Culture

LCID             Name             DisplayName
----             ----             -----------
127                               Invariant Language (Invariant Country)
```

On my Debian 11 machine:

```powershell
PS /> dir Env:/LANG

Name                           Value
----                           -----
LANG                           en_US.UTF-8

PS /> Get-Culture

LCID             Name             DisplayName
----             ----             -----------
1033             en-US            English (United States)
```

comments.author: conclavia
comments.body:
Thanks, @sdwheeler! Adding the `-UICulture en-US` parameter has indeed fixed the problem :thumbsup: :green_heart:

Interestingly, `$env:LANG` on my machine is set to a value that is actually supported by `Get-Culture` (`en_AU.UTF-8`), just not one that help is available in.

If I try to run `Update-Help` and explicitly pass `-UICulture en-AU` (or `en-GB`, etc) then I get back an error telling me that no help is available and to try `-UICulture en-US` instead. But if I don't pass any `-UICulture` parameter it just fails silently. That doesn't seem to line up with the note in the `Update-Help` docs which only mentions `C.UTF.8` as an issue.

So it seems like maybe the main problem here is less the fact that the help isn't updating, and more the fact that it is failing silently rather than with a helpful error message?

```powershell
PS /home/user> dir env:\LANG

Name                           Value
----                           -----
LANG                           en_AU.UTF-8

PS /home/user> Get-Culture

LCID             Name             DisplayName
----             ----             -----------
3081             en-AU            English (Australia)

PS /home/user> Get-UICulture

LCID             Name             DisplayName
----             ----             -----------
3081             en-AU            English (Australia)

PS /home/user> Update-Help -Scope AllUsers -UICulture en-AU -Force -Verbose
VERBOSE: Resolving URI: "https://aka.ms/powershell71-help"                                                              
VERBOSE: Your connection has been redirected to the following URI: "https://pshelpprod.blob.core.windows.net/cabinets/powershell-7.1/"
VERBOSE: Resolving URI: "https://aka.ms/powershell70-help"                                                              
VERBOSE: Your connection has been redirected to the following URI: "https://pshelpprod.blob.core.windows.net/cabinets/powershell-7/"
VERBOSE: Resolving URI: "https://aka.ms/powershell72-help"                                                              
VERBOSE: Your connection has been redirected to the following URI: "https://pshelpprod.blob.core.windows.net/cabinets/powershell-7.2/"
VERBOSE: Resolving URI: "https://aka.ms/powershell72-help"                                                              
VERBOSE: Your connection has been redirected to the following URI: "https://pshelpprod.blob.core.windows.net/cabinets/powershell-7.2/"
VERBOSE: Resolving URI: "https://aka.ms/powershell72-help"

VERBOSE: Resolving URI: "https://aka.ms/powershell72-help"                                                              
VERBOSE: Your connection has been redirected to the following URI: "https://pshelpprod.blob.core.windows.net/cabinets/powershell-7.2/"
VERBOSE: Resolving URI: "https://aka.ms/powershell70-help"

VERBOSE: Your connection has been redirected to the following URI: "https://pshelpprod.blob.core.windows.net/cabinets/powershell-7.2/"
Update-Help: Failed to update Help for the module(s) 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive, Microsoft.PowerShell.Core, Microsoft.PowerShell.Host, Microsoft.PowerShell.Management, Microsoft.PowerShell.Security, Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility, PackageManagement, PowerShellGet, PSReadLine, ThreadJob' with UI culture(s) {en-AU} : No UI culture was found that matches the following pattern: en-AU. Verify the pattern and then try the command again..
English-US help content is available and can be installed using: Update-Help -UICulture en-US.
```

comments.author: rokejulianlockhart
comments.body:
My culture is C.UTF.8, which as "http://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/17400#issuecomment-1135205557" explains is problematic, yet Get-Culture invokes correctly.

```
[A1653237104@1653307616 ~]$ pwsh-preview
PowerShell 7.3.0-preview.3
PS /home/A1653237104> update-help
PS /home/A1653237104> get-help update-help                                                                              

NAME
    Update-Help
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Help [[-Module] <string[]>] [[-SourcePath] <string[]>] [[-UICulture] <cultureinfo[]>] [-FullyQualifiedModule <ModuleSpecification[]>] [-Recurse] [-Credential <pscredential>] 
    [-UseDefaultCredentials] [-Force] [-Scope {CurrentUser | AllUsers}] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    Update-Help [[-Module] <string[]>] [[-UICulture] <cultureinfo[]>] [-FullyQualifiedModule <ModuleSpecification[]>] [-LiteralPath <string[]>] [-Recurse] [-Credential <pscredential>] 
    [-UseDefaultCredentials] [-Force] [-Scope {CurrentUser | AllUsers}] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]
    

ALIASES
    None
    

REMARKS
    Get-Help cannot find the Help files for this cmdlet on this computer. It is displaying only partial help.
        -- To download and install Help files for the module that includes this cmdlet, use Update-Help.
        -- To view the Help topic for this cmdlet online, type: "Get-Help Update-Help -Online" or
           go to https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=2096805.


PS /home/A1653237104> get-culture

LCID             Name             DisplayName
----             ----             -----------
2057             en-GB            English (United Kingdom)

PS /home/A1653237104>
```

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as answered and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: Get-Help does not find help files on Ubuntu 22.04 / PowerShell 7.2.4
